title: Burkina Faso Balance of Trade
description: Burkina Faso recorded a trade deficit of 62.10 XOF Billion in the second quarter of 2022. Balance of Trade in Burkina Faso averaged -37.94 XOF Billion from 1998 until 2022, reaching an all time high of 200.80 XOF Billion in the first quarter of 2021 and a record low of -276.30 XOF Billion in the third quarter of 2018. Burkina Faso’s systemic trade deficit is due to the country’s dependence on fuel imports and volatile exports. A drought prone climate and commodities price fluctuations influence Burkina Faso’s main exports: gold (70 percent of total exports) and cotton (13 percent). Burkina Faso main trading partners are: China, France and Ivory Coast. This page provides - Burkina Faso Balance of Trade - actual values, historical data, forecast, chart, statistics, economic calendar and news.
